And the first thing I want to talk about today is actually a story about a person I used to include in my thumbnails as clickbait, Kate Upton was in the news.
You may have seen on January 31st, Kate Upton alluded to fashion brand Guess' co-founder Paul Marciano assaulting her.
She tweeted out, "It's disappointing that such an iconic women's brand Guess is still empowering Paul Marciano as their creative director,
hashtag Me Too." Also posting an image of her tweet on her Instagram with the caption,
"He shouldn't be allowed to use his power in the industry to sexually and emotionally harass women, hashtag Me Too."
Now Upton didn't immediately elaborate on what happened but
her statement had an immediate effect on the fashion brand. Within hours of her initial tweet, Guess' shares dropped by more than 17 percent.
Now, obviously keep in mind this happened during that dip in the stock market, but 17 percent is a whole lot more than 4 percent.
Marciano has responded to Upton's post, giving TMZ a one-page statement
Saying he never touched up dinner was alone with her
And that he has built a brand with a quote "long, and proud history of empowering women", also noting Upton's timing her,
saying, "She leveled this malicious and false accusation only hours before a gala event at our headquarters in Los Angeles unveiling a new guest campaign."
Also, saying he felt Upton statements provided no facts, no details, no dates, and no circumstances to corroborate her allegations.
So then yesterday Upton provides details, dates, circumstances, and witnesses in a Time article
Upton says that on the first day of her lingerie issue with Guess, Marciano forcibly grabbed her breasts.
He kissed her against her will, he grabbed her thighs and arms to pull closer so he could smell her.
He also allegedly told photographer Yu Tsai to leave the room so he could, be alone with Upton. Tsai has also corroborated Upton's story.
Following that, she said, "Then Paul insisted that he walk me up to my hotel room. I immediately declined."
"The only thing I was thinking is 'If he touches me like that in public, I can't imagine what he tried to do in private'."
"Thankfully, Yu Tsai stepped in and insisted he do it."
"I was so relieved and I felt like I had barely escaped."
And following all of this, Kate said the harassment assault made her reconsider her career saying,
"It took a huge toll on my confidence and self-worth. I wanted to quit modeling. I constantly blamed myself after it happened.
What am i doing to invite someone to treat me like that or grab me like that? I wondered if it was how i was presenting myself or what i was wearing.
I started slumping my shoulders to hide my breast size, wearing baggy, clothes, started despising my own body."
But then calling on the industry to change, saying,
"The culture of complacency and tolerance in our industry needs to stop.
People know what is going on and have previously accepted it and we can't always require the victims to be the ones
to speak up and tell their story, because the victims only know their one story."
